survey.title: PROPOSED BEST PRACTICE GUIDELINES TO CLARIFY THE MEANING OF “NONCOMMERCIAL” IN THE CREATIVE COMMONS LICENSES

screen.title: Section A: Nature of the user

question.title: Is the user an “allowable NC user” under the noncommercial license condition? Allowable NC users are: (a) an individual, (b) a nonprofit educational institution/library, (c) Nonprofit organization as defined under US1 or equivalent law, (together with (1) and (2) “allowable NC users”), or (d) A copy shop, ISP or similar service provider who, in the course of providing a service at the direction of the allowable NC user, may exercise a right licensed under the Creative Commons license.

screen.title: Section B. Nature of the use: Advertising

question.title: Is the NC-licensed content being used in an advertisement for third party products or services?

screen.title: Section B. Nature of the use: Advertising

question.title: Is viewing of an advertisement for third party products or services required as a condition of accessing or viewing the NC-licensed content (eg. “click-through” advertising)?

screen.title: Section B. Nature of the use: Advertising

question.title: Is the NC-licensed work being used in connection with advertisements for third party products or services where the NC-licensed work is the primary draw or a is substantial amount, both qualitatively and quantitatively?

screen.title: Section C. Conditions on Use: For Services Provided

question.title: Is money changing hands in exchange for a service provided in connection with the NC-licensed work?

screen.title: Section C. Conditions on Use: For Services Provided

question.title: Is money changing hands for a service being provided to (in the case of, for example, a for-profit copy shop) or by an allowable NC user incidental to the use of the NC-licensed work (e.g. course packs provided by an educational institutions)?

screen.title: Section D. Conditions on Use: Original Work

question.title: Is there any money changing hands in connection with the use of the NC licensed work? Money may change hands in connection with the use of an NC-licensed work in at least four ways:

options.option: As a condition of using the NC-licensed work

As a condition of using another work that includes an NC-licensed work, where the NC-licensed work is either the primary draw or a substantial amount (whether qualitatively or quantitatively) of the primary draw

As a condition of using another work that includes a verbatim NC-licensed work, where the NC-licensed work is not the primary draw or is an insubstantial amount, both qualitatively and quantitatively, as long as there is no charge for accessing the NC-licensed work

As an optional contribution (e.g., a tip jar, donations, membership drive) for an allowed NC user (diverges from PDF!) that uses the verbatim NC-licensed work or another work that includes a verbatim NC-licensed work

screen.title: Section E. Conditions on Use: Derivative Works

question.title: Does the work use a ShareAlike license condition?

screen.title: Section E. Conditions on Use: Derivative Works

question.title: Does the creation of derivative works match with the terms given in Section D?

screen.title: Section E. Conditions on Use: Derivative Works

question.title: Is the money changing hands in connection with a derivative use of an NC licensed work? Money can change hands one of these four ways; select the one most appropriate to your use.

options.option: As a condition of using a derivative work based on an NC-licensed work, of which the original NC-licensed work is the primary draw or a substantial amount, whether qualitatively or quantitatively, of that derivative work

As a condition of using a derivative work based on an NC-licensed work, of which the original NC-licensed work is not the primary draw or is an insubstantial amount, both qualitatively and quantitatively, of that derivative work
As an optional contribution (e.g., a tip jar, donations, membership drive) for an allowed NC user (DIVERGES FROM PDF!) that uses the derivative work based on the NC-licensed work
